text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
Updated case closing procedures, modifying the guidance as listed below:

Section Modiﬁcation IRM 7.21.5.5 Removed paragraph (2) and the two notes, which contained guidance on closing time frames and transaction code 590. IRM 7.21.5.5.1 Removed information pertaining to EDS specialist number 31748. IRM 7.21.5.5.2 Added new step on the Update Master Record screen in EDS. IRM 7.21.5.6.1 Removed instruction to discard purge material. IRM 7.21.5.6.2 Removed directions to discard purge material. IRM 7.21.5.6.3 Added new guidance with respect to Form 1023-EZ and non-Form 1023-EZ cases.
Incorporated procedures in Interim Guidance Memorandum TEGE 07-0516-0011, Interim Guidance on Preventing Erroneous Revocations, at IRM 7.21.5.9.
Added new program, scope and objectives content at IRM 7.21.5.1 , as per IRM 1.11.2.2.5.
Edited the document for plain language, as required per the Plain Writing Act of 2010.
This supersedes IRM 7.21.5 dated October 2, 2015.
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Exempt Organizations
Table of Contents
Case Processing Assistance 7.21.5
EO R&A Employees, including tax examining technicians, secretaries, and clerks, help with EO and EP determination cases processing including:

Rev. Proc. 2018-5, updated annually, lists procedures for issuing determination letters on exempt status (in response to applications for recognition of exemption from federal income tax under Section 501 or 521 other than those subject to Rev. Proc. 2018-4, updated annually, private foundation status, and other determinations related to exempt organizations). The determination letters are under the jurisdiction of the Director, EO Rulings and Agreements.

To request an EDS case establishment, prepare and email Form 14263, Request for Case Establishment, to *TEGE Determinations Processing.

Exempt Organizations Determinations Processing
Note: EO generally uses three accession numbers: FTE cases not stored at Florence, Form 1023-EZ cases, and EOCC (cases not established in
Input the following information for every closed case: • EDS case number • EIN • Organization name control • Pack/box number • Accession number For documents to be back end scanned: a. Place

cases in a folder (put your initials on folder). b. Place the next pre-printed pack number on the folder. c. Place ﬁve folders in a box for shipment to CSPC. d. Label the box with the ﬁve pack numbers. e. Print three Form

or other acceptable documentation (place box and keep one). f. Ship to CSPC (CSPC ships to Florence after scanning; Florence closed cases to FRC). For documents to be shipped to Florence for association with hard a. Box the documents. b. Print three Form

or other acceptable documentation with a description of the contents (place two in box and keep one). c. Ship full box to Florence (Florence ships closed cases to FRC). For cases to be shipped directly to FRC: a. Place the cases in a box. b. Print three Form

or other acceptable documentation (place box and keep one). c. Write accession number and box numbers in black marker in the ate areas on the front of the box. Caution: Don’t write on the front of the box without manager d. Ship full box to FRC.
Case Processing Assistance 7.21.5
The Files & Records Unit prepares and ships EP closed determination cases for scanning and storage.

To prepare closed EP cases stored in Cincinnati: a. Remove all paper clips and rubber bands. Note: You don’t have to remove staples. b. Discard all envelopes. c. Review case ﬁle to ensure associated documents are in the ﬁle. d. Place the closing sheet on the inside top of the case. e. Assign a sequence number to each case in numeric order. printed sequence label on ﬁle. f. Organize cases sequentially in boxes beginning with the lowest the front of the box. Note: Leave room in box for future document associations. g. Place a pre-printed box label on box. h. Write the assigned accession and box numbers in black marker propriate areas on the front of the box. Caution: Don’t write anything in the squares on the front of the i. Ship cases to FRC when

boxes are ready. To prepare closed EP cases stored in Florence: a. Place documents in the order listed below. b. Place seven sets of case documents in a folder. c. Place four folders in a ﬁle to send to CSPC. • Green separator sheet • EDS Closing sheet • Final Letter Control Sheet • Sheet indicating “None” • Disclosable Control Sheet • Sheet indicating “None” • Non-Disclosable Control Sheet • Sheet indicating “None”
Note: After scanning, CSPC sends the documents back to the Files & Records Unit to reuse the folders.
For hard copy documents that need to be associated with case ﬁles held in Florence: a. Attach an AIS to the documents. b. Ship to Florence.

Note: In TRAC, only enter cases shipping directly from Cincinnati Files & Unit to FRC. (

) To verify case information is entered correctly: a. Click Query (Alt Q). b. Click on box number and enter the box number. c. Input the accession number. d. Click Run (Alt R). e. Check the sequence numbers using the Next (Alt N) and Previous (Alt buttons to verify box contents were properly input. (
) Repack box as necessary and seal. Place the mailing label above or center seam. (

Research IDRS, EDS, DVD Master List, TEDS, and the Processing Record database to determine the location of an administrative ﬁle. After locating the administrative ﬁle, secure and deliver the ﬁle to the requestor and complete Form
, EP/EO DETERMINATIONS PROCESSING USE ONLY section. Locate administrative ﬁles on DVD:
Processing Assistance
page a. Research the DVD Master List using the EIN. If no results, research the name control for cases closed on EDS up through

b. If there is a DVD, write the DVD number on the request. c. Retrieve the DVD from the DVD ﬁle cabinet. d. Insert the DVD into a computer, locate the case ﬁle, and drag the ﬁle to your desktop to make a copy. e. Send the ﬁle to the requestor by email, OCS, or by burning a copy to a DVD. (

) Locate administrative ﬁles on TEDS: a. Use the Advanced Search feature locate a case ﬁle. b. If you ﬁnd the case on TEDS, make a folder on a computer desktop the EIN. c. Open the folder in TEDS and click on Documents. d. Click on Disclosable. e. Highlight all forms. f. Click on File. g. Select Export (this should show the EIN folder you created and cally import the documents). Use the same procedures for requested disclosable documents. h. Send the documents to the requestor by email, OCS, or hard copy printout. (
) Locate and request administrative ﬁles in Florence or CSPC: a. Review the DLN to determine if the case ﬁle is or was stored in (in other words, second set of DLN digits
or higher, and last digit

higher). b. Review the closed case database to determine if/when information was shipped to CSPC for scanning. c. For documents in CSPC, call CSPC and request documents be d. For documents in Florence, complete Form
, Records Request, Charge and Recharge, Parts A and B and fax it to Florence. e. When you receive the case ﬁle, prepare Form
or other acceptable documentation and send any hard copy documents to the requestor. f. When the requestor returns the case ﬁle, send it back to Florence. (

) Locate and request administrative ﬁles at the Federal Records Center boro, Ohio): a. Research the EO Closed Case Database for the EO accession number and box or TRAC for the EP case number. b. Complete an OS Get Services request including Form OF-
, Reference Request - Federal Records Center. c. Fax a coversheet and the OF-

to a support service specialist in Covington, KY, Facilities Management. d. When you receive the case from the FRC, enter the information on the tracking spreadsheet; put a label on the back of the ﬁle with identifying information; prepare a Form

or other acceptable documentation; deliver to the requestor. e. When the requestor returns the case, enter the information into the tracking spreadsheet and return the case to the FRC. f. Review the status of outstanding cases periodically (such as every
days) for case control.

to the designated assistant to generate a Business Objects (BOBJ) report with EP/EO Determination System (EDS) case information for each organization. (

) Review the BOBJ report and eliminate the following organizations as poten- tially erroneous revocations: • Organizations that don’t have a closed case on EDS. • Organizations whose cases were closed on EDS prior to May
, (i.e., the earliest date of revocation). • Organizations whose effective dates were prior to May

organizations and identify tions that will be erroneously revoked. Research may include but is not to: • IDRS research for completed TC
s, Form

to Status

) Before the next scheduled automatic revocation update (and allowing for trans- action posting times), update IDRS for each preventable erroneous revocation. Update IDRS to reﬂect Status
and the appropriate ﬁling requirement(s) as determined by the employee that worked the case. Note: Because the organization won’t be in Status
at the time of the next extract, the system won’t generate a CP
A automatic revocation notice to the organization, and the organization won’t be listed on EO Select Check as automatically revoked. Also, completed TC
s will prevent future erroneous revocations.
